website_summaries.verdict: This small steaming iron can work as a steamer or iron, but if you're not looking to iron at all, you might prefer a regular steamer.
pros: Slightly larger than a computer mouse, this steaming iron heats up and cools down quickly and is also great for seamstresses and quilters
cons: The manufacturer suggests using distilled water

website_summaries.verdict: Affordable option with a useful steam function and adjustable temperature. Backed by a one-year warranty.
pros: Convenient dual-voltage construction and small size make it great for travel
Generates quite a bit of steam considering its small water reservoir
cons: The small size means that ironing multiple pieces of clothing may take longer than with a traditional iron

customer_reviews.title: Small but powerful
customer_reviews.text: This little iron is small but mighty. Only complaint, it’s almost ridiculous but it does affect my usage. Because it’s so small and powerful the entire unit gets hot. The handle area gets very warm.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Lagasse

customer_reviews.title: Did not like
customer_reviews.text: I did not like this little steam iron. I bought it for traveling in my camper. I just opened it up this past weekend...... to try it. I quilt while I am camping and wanted someting small to set my seams. Well this little iron spilled water all over from the bottom part where you press.. Water would not stay in the little holes. I would love to send it back for a refund. Is this possible. Please respond. Thank you. Sue
customer_reviews.author: sue donnenwirth

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it! You will Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This Iron is absolutely the best! Didn't know I would use it so much. Sure, I knew I would use it for Quilting/sewing, but I find it being my go to Iron for fast pressing and touching things up. By the time my big expensive iron is filled with water and heats up, I'm about finished by using this one. You won't be disappointed. I love it and am thinking about buying another one for a back up. I have had this a few years so I am not just writing a review about something that may not last. This is built to Last!
customer_reviews.author: rainbowbrite

customer_reviews.title: Great little iron!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little leary after reading some reviews, but decided to purchase and try it out. I'm glad I did! This little iron holds its own with a lot of heat for such a small iron. I use it for pressing my piecing with my little pressing matt while away from my big iron. This presses so well, and has a place for water to steam. The water dribbles out, that is the only thing I don't care for, however the heat that this little iron gives out overcomes this minor flaw. I recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Angie H.

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: It's perfect for patchwork because the size is small. It's easy to use. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Maria Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect this iron to last long
customer_reviews.text: I bought this iron in 2015 and was initially really happy with its performance. I have not used the iron much since I bought it, and on a recent trip, I was totally dismayed when it started to leak. It's not a small leak that can be fixed, but rather a major failure of the gray rubber gasket around the top of the handle. I'm very disappointed to find this is just another piece of junk that gets used a few times and then tossed because it no longer works.
customer_reviews.author: EG

customer_reviews.title: BURNS YOUR FINGERS
customer_reviews.text: The white casing all the way up to the neck going to the handle gets so hot it can burn your fingertips as you hold the iron. There is no warning about this in the booklet that comes with the iron. It also leaks when you use the steam function. The stem of the cord comes out so low that it sometimes interferes with the clothing being ironed. I really liked that it was lightweight, heated fast, but the possibility of being burned again and the leaking made me return it.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: No Steam
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little iron for quilting, however after only 6 months the steam no longer works. Very disappointed in the life of this iron.
customer_reviews.author: pcrawford

customer_reviews.title: Defective product
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed in this iron. Water that was poured in for steam kept leaking out of the bottom of the dial. I returned it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: morie

customer_reviews.title: Must have for those that sew!
customer_reviews.text: My best friend is an amazing seamstress so I bought this for her for Christmas last year. She loves this thing and says it her sewing baby. She does a lot of intricate work so she is able to keep this thing on her table as she works out of the way and it makes her world so much easier. Good buy! UPDATE! My friend has had this for over a year and she uses it literally every day! She says it still works great and she's so happy with it :)
customer_reviews.author: ILAHMACHE

customer_reviews.title: It was AMAZING until it wasn't...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for a trip to Africa. It was essential that we packed light. The good reviews and the product description won us over. I loved this iron! It was perfect! Until it just didn't turn on. DEAD. Just AFTER the deadline to send it back. We never used it for long periods of time, only a few minutes each ironing session (because I wanted to treat it gently!). So disappointed, I had such high hopes! Edit 8/20/19. I contacted the company and they shipped me a new replacement iron right away. Excellent company for doing business with 👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: Tamster

customer_reviews.title: Great as a dry iron only
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived on time and was as described. The iron when you're using it without steam is wonderful, but the minute water is added the iron leaks all over the place. I tried add below the line each half of the cup that comes with the iron and it's the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: J Brunson

customer_reviews.title: Best compact travel iron.
customer_reviews.text: I totally recommend this product. I received it today which was right on time. This iron does everything it claims it does. It’s very small, compact and lightweight for traveling. It comes with its own travel bag and water measuring cup to fill the iron. They do recommend however, in order to extend the life of your unit and keep it functioning at its maximum potential, you use distilled or D mineralized water in the water tank. I will continue using this iron for the next couple of weeks to make sure there are no Issues with it as some people have complained about it previous reviews. Check back later for my update.
customer_reviews.author: Gee Gee

customer_reviews.title: Easy to handle and it’s a great travel companion!
customer_reviews.text: OMG! I just love this iron, I took it around the block for a spin and loved it! Heated up fine and easy to use and storage is a breeze, comes with a little cup to fill for steam! The only thing I would suggest to people is to be careful of your fingers because the base is hot even on the top. I accidentally touched the upper part of the base and it was hot. Make sure you keep your fingers curled around the handle just to be on the safe side! Great product, well made and it’s so cute as well!
customer_reviews.author: forevablessed13

customer_reviews.title: great for travel and small jobs
customer_reviews.text: bought this for travel. we often head south of the border and only ear casual clothes. our washer/dryer leaves waistbands, shirt collars and button plackets (is that the right word) wrinkled. just need a little touch up and don't want to use a full sized iron. this works great for our needs. small, light and easy to use. you would not mistake the results as those of a full size iron but it is more than adequate for simple demands. steam option is a big plus in a small iron. my wife sews and between trips it is used regularly in the sewing room for small projects.
customer_reviews.author: yajaru

customer_reviews.title: Wow, the Little Iron That Could!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this iron for my quilting projects. My sewing area is small and I was tired of the big ironing board and full size steam iron taking up so much space, when I mostly need to iron small pieces. This tiny little steam iron is amazing. I tested it out on a dozen very wrinkled cotton-poly napkins and was blown away by what a great job the iron did. I was also impressed with how quickly it heats up. I don't particularly like ironing, but this makes it fun.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: Good for on the go
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for a month (3-4 times a week) before writing this review. I like how portable it is. It heats up pretty fast and is easy to use. Cons: I hold the top and try not to let my fingers grip close to the middle of the handle, trying to get a better grip on it, since it gets very hot. Also, I don't know when the water runs out. Unless I need to refill it with water every 2-3 days, it will evaporate quickly. Well, for the size I can't ask for more. It is good for on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Jess HybridRose

customer_reviews.title: well made
customer_reviews.text: I filled with water as instructed with spray button in down position. heated to max, then used the steam with no dripping at all. you cannot use steam at lower temperature as instructed. by following the instruction, it worked very well. no leak no dripping. easy to hold. long cord. well made. nice compact size for travel or sewing. I wish it came with a case better than a bag. I guess they didn't want to raise the price or their cost. The bag is semi protective.
customer_reviews.author: Teufic H

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for sewing projects!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this cute little thing for sewing. I have been doing a lot of sewing lately and my big, bulky, old iron wasn’t cutting it anymore. This is perfect for steaming and pressing. It heats up very quickly and is easy to use. I’m a little concerned that as it gets older the water will start to leak out over the controls, but it has not yet. I make sure to empty the reservoir when I’m not using it.
customer_reviews.author: Izzy D

customer_reviews.title: I love this iron!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this iron to use at my sewing table. It was a pain to set up my big ironing board and iron abd walk across the room everytime I needed to press a piece of my quilting project- just not worth it. This iron has a really long cord, so it works great right at my sewing table. It is hot and steam comes out fast so it presses really well. Honestly, the results are better than my big iron. This will be going on trips with me since I'm sure it will work well for clothes too. A great buy!
customer_reviews.author: KelH

customer_reviews.title: Mighty little iron
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this little iron not for travel but to use while sewing. I set up a small ironing pad next to my sewing machine so I could press seams without having to get up from my machine and therefore expedite my progress. So pleased and happy with my purchase. This little iron does an amazing job. Would absolutely recommend it to anyone who needs a little iron for small projects.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Manning

customer_reviews.title: Cord is on the right side, doesn't work for me!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this iron to use next to my sewing machine so I don't have to keep getting up and walking to other side of the room every 3 minutes while making masks. It works well for that. But the cord is on the right and I have to plug it in on the left so it's in my way all the time. Very annoying. Wish the cord was on the back! Also the handle doesn't get hot but the body does, and it's hard to keep your fingers totally away from it because of the small size. It's not going to cause a burn, but might startle you. I would totally buy it again except for the cord issue!
customer_reviews.author: Violet

customer_reviews.title: Great craft iron
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this iron specifically to use for crafts. The shape makes it easy to hold with the water holding tank acting as a handle. I have very small hands and this fits perfectly. This iron is more economical than the mini craft irons. I have used this for placing iron-on vinyl on coffee cups. I did test the steam function just to see if it works. It works great. The iron heats up quickly so it's ready to use without a lot of waiting. If you want this for travel, the size is perfect for that.
customer_reviews.author: Share the Knowledge

customer_reviews.title: Great little steam iron.
customer_reviews.text: Great little iron! The burst of steam is impressive. I was worried I was going to have to fill the water chamber continuously however filling the chamber gives you an adequate amount of time to do a couple projects. I use it for quilting on my table mat and it is amazing! Some of the reviews complain about water leakage, read the directions, simply pushing the steam button down and laying the iron flat on a silicone pad takes care of the leaks. Of course empty it before traveling.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: PERFECTION!
customer_reviews.text: This little iron is PERFECT! It’s the cutest little appliance I’ll ever own (and I have a mini Frigidaire) and I just couldn’t be happier with it. I got it mostly for ironing patches onto clothing and for quick wrinkle fixes, and it’s phenomenal for both. My clothes are always crisp after using it, and my patches stay right where I want them. I highly recommend this iron. It heats up so quickly and works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Second one  First one failed to heat after less than a year
customer_reviews.text: loved my first one Very handy in my sewing room Very dissapointed that it failed to heat after about a year using it and only really daily use for the last three months. No response from company re warranty which really annoys me but having said that I opted for another. A glutton for punishment? Maybe they will see this and respond! Added onto: When my new one came there was an 800 number which I called and they were so nice Will replace it under warranty! Now I have two that I really like using. Would really recommend it Just keep paper work in case of failure.
customer_reviews.author: Nana to 8

customer_reviews.title: I think going to like it
customer_reviews.text: Received timely. Small, sleek, easy to handle. Still getting use to which temp I need to use. Do not fill cup up to line indicated for water, it's too much and will overflow iron. BE CAREFUL of steam. It does 'spit' out a little water when it gets heated up and it gets VERY hot on high temp. I don't see this as a problem, just be aware. I think I'm going to like it esp making face masks and small kids clothes. Does a much better job getting in those tight places.
customer_reviews.author: MyMy

customer_reviews.title: Great for Quilters
customer_reviews.text: Neat little iron. Great iron for quilting. Seams on small pieces flattened quickly. Have recommended to friends. When sewing you do turn an iron On/Off frequently. Only concern is that to turn the On/Off switch becomes difficult. I had to use a dime in the groove on the On/Off switch to make it easier to turn. Great because it only uses 420 watts of power. Also had to contact Steamfast customer service and they could not have been more professional and courteous.
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for quilters
customer_reviews.text: I love this little iron! I made my own ironing mat and keep it beside my sewing machine so I can press seams open as I piece a quilt top. I sewed for 4 hours yesterday, pressing seams open every few pieces, and this stayed on and was still providing steam when I turned it off. It is lightweight, which is great, but p the cord is heavy so you want to secure the cord (i set a can of beans on the end of it at the edge of my ironing mat). Love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: BGuhl

customer_reviews.title: Mighty Mini
customer_reviews.text: This little gem of an iron is perfect for quilters. It's like the very best thing in my quilting toolshed that I wish I'd gotten it 20 years ago. No more big bulky iron. No more not being able to see what you're doing. It's excellent for almost everything a quilter could need to iron. Five "HUGE" stars Thank you Steamfast! You changed my life! Okay, it is a pandemic. Quilting makes me happy and this tiny iron packs a huge punch. Buy it now!
customer_reviews.author: GIRLS ARE GREAT

customer_reviews.title: I don't need a mini iron, I wanted a steamer... maybe I read into this wrong, but don't most all irons have a steam feature?
customer_reviews.text: Not even close to what I was expecting. I don't need a mini iron, I wanted a steamer... maybe I read into this wrong, but don't most all irons have a steam feature... so why call this out as a steamer iron? It may be a fine product, but I really don't know why I would carry a real iron around with me when almost every hotel I have ever been to has an iron in the room. Had it been a steamer, and had as good of reviews as it has, then I may love it. Unfortunately, I don't love this.
customer_reviews.author: Jason C Park

customer_reviews.title: it gets hot hot hot!
customer_reviews.text: I didnt think it would do full size iron hot but it does. The only thing is, dont let your fingers touch the base part while gripping the top handle part. It really does a good job of ironing and puts out some steam. You will have to refill the water frequently because the water port is so small but it will steam!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: perfect for sewing, compact, use with a pad on the sewing table. Saw one being used in a how to video. Don't know how I managed before ! Very easy to use especially since I have arthritis now and it's so light.
customer_reviews.author: Gary W Reid

customer_reviews.title: Worked for about 5 minutes
customer_reviews.text: The first time I turned it on the iron worked fine. I used it for about 5 minutes. About half an hour later I tried to use it again and it would not turn on. So I wasted my money. Lesson learned for this brand.
customer_reviews.author: dkh

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't ask for a better sewing/travel tool
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews I decided to go ahead and order this travel iron. While most hotels now have an iron and board in the room I wanted this for my sewing rather than travel. The big Rowenta I have does get hot and I know it causes the electric meter to whirl. This small travel iron works exceptionally well, doesn't heat up the work area and easier on the electric bill. Compact, heats up fast and steams quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Wemyss Lassie

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Where has this iron been all my sewing life. I love it. It gets plenty hot and has adjustable temperatures. Lightweight. Fit well in your hand and works beautifully. The steam actually works better than my full size iron. I was worried that it didn’t hold much water but not really a problem. The steam lasted for a good long time. Smooth sole plate and easy to fill with water as well. Very happy with this purchase wish I found out about it earlier. It makes it so easy to put next to my sewing machine and use on my quilters cut and press pad.
customer_reviews.author: LCM

customer_reviews.title: less than expected
customer_reviews.text: dial very hard to read because contrast of print isn't really there...black l[print would be best for those of us how have trouble seeing & i never could get a speck of steam just dribbles of water... size is perfect... has an easy hand you don't get tired using it
customer_reviews.author: Danielle D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: A dud of an iron.
customer_reviews.text: According to reviews I read about this iron it is either very good or very bad. I got a bad one. And promptly returned it. It leaked water water from the get go. NEVER any steam. Just water spots. And the iron would never heat to a degree that I could actually press with it. It would turn for a few seconds and get a little hot, but then as soon I would go to use it it would grow cold. So a very big dud. The makers of this iron need to do more with quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Tweeddale

customer_reviews.title: No Steam
customer_reviews.text: I bought this iron for my quilting room upon the recommendation of a number of websites and after reading the reviews on Amazon. I love many if it’s features but it absolutely never steams. It heats nicely and I have followed all recommendations.
customer_reviews.author: Awright55

customer_reviews.title: Heats up quickly.
customer_reviews.text: The controls are hard to turn and it's not easy to regulate the temperature. However, it is great for seam pressing when constructing small projects. The handle is easy to hold and just glides over the fabric. Plugged into a surge protector cable, I just turn the switch off or on once I have the correct temperture set on the iron.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Releasing Steam Completely
customer_reviews.text: The steam iron worked as advertised for three uses and now releases no steam. Have tried different outlets, different voltage settings, different water volumes & temperature settings and nothing has helped. Extremely discouraging considering total use with the iron is 3 times and less than 15 minutes. At this moment would steer clear and not purchase anything from this company. Reaching out to customer service to try to remedy the problem and will update with the resolution provided.
customer_reviews.author: Mei

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient!
customer_reviews.text: Very convenient! After a couple of trips to Europe where they don't allow irons in rooms, i decided to buy one before my trip to Costa Rica. I was glad I did, as one of the hotels I stayed at didn't allow irons in the room and you would have to send your clothes to get ironed. This little iron is light weight and serves it's purpose. Clearly it's not going to do the same job as a regular size iron (iron the same about of space in the same amount of time). It is a mini version after all. But I loved having this handy!
customer_reviews.author: Lillian

customer_reviews.title: This little iron is a WONDER for my sewing projects!
customer_reviews.text: This small compact Iron is great! I use this for a small work area right next to my sewing machine so I can easily iron my projects as I sew them without having to get up out of my chair, walk over to the big ironing board etc.. Saves time for me and my projects are done much faster! It gets very hot and the steam function is very good too. I was worried the water would run out quickly because so little can fit in it, but to my surprise, it did not, just be sure not to leave it on steam mode when it's set upright. LOVE THIS LITTLE IRON!!
customer_reviews.author: luv2bsassy2

customer_reviews.title: Save your money - iron won’t steam
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited about getting this small iron for my sewing projects, especially the mask I’ve been making. I have to say I am very disappointed in it because it won’t release steam. The indicators on the iron are very intuitive but it won’t release steam. And of course I am past the return date so now I’m stuck with an iron that won’t steam - which is important when working with 100%cotton fabric. If you are looking for a small iron that is easy to travel with and don’t care that it doesn’t steam, this one would work. If you’re looking for steam, this is not the product for you.
customer_reviews.author: Bergetta F.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: The price was better than JoAnn's since coupons can't be used on their irons. I've wanted this iron for ages and haven't been disappointed. Gets very hot. I don't use it as a steam iron but use a spray bottle when I need that so I can't speak to the leaks people mention. Besides it uses very little water so why not use a spray bottle instead. I always order enough not to pay S&H so it came out cheaper than JoAnn's. It's just what I was looking for to take to quilt retreats and guild sew in days.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kearns

customer_reviews.title: Great for apartment living
customer_reviews.text: I don’t have many clothes that need ironing, but I really hate when the sewn in cuff on shorts or shirts start to roll up. This iron worked great, I was really surprised at how powerful this small iron is. It’s the perfect size for storing in a small apartment, I also got the ironing mat which worked great with the iron.
customer_reviews.author: Bcampbell

customer_reviews.title: Great little iron!
customer_reviews.text: Saw this in a YouTube mask making video and thought it would save me from climbing down to basement every time I needs to press masks. Blown away by how great it is! Light weight, quickly heats, uses a tiny amount of water yet steam lasts for hours, comfortable to hold, lots of settings. Can see using it for travel too, although not bought for that purpose. Update: still like the functionality of this iron, but the rubber trim where my thumb rests is already wearing off. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Edith Grace

customer_reviews.title: I love this little iron thing
customer_reviews.text: This changed the way I work for the better. I no longer have to lug out the big guns iron for my small sewing jobs. Very very handy! Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Housecharmer

customer_reviews.title: Read the instructions first before using
customer_reviews.text: I like this iron just for miniature doll clothes making. I wouldn’t use for ironing my clothes because I don’t think it gets hot enough. Also, if you decided to purchase this iron, read the instructions first before using. It helped me to avoid some of the problems I read about in others reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Mamma Gator

customer_reviews.title: Love this iron!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this little iron. I keep it set up on one side of my craft table and when I need to iron a seam or fold, it is so handy. No more setting up an ironing board and hauling out my big iron! I made two ironing pads, one small and one bigger and use the little iron on those. It fits nicely in the palm of your hand for ironing and gets really hot and steamy. It fits really well in small areas to be ironed.
customer_reviews.author: Bethsj

customer_reviews.title: Keep a spray bottle of water for your cotton items close by
customer_reviews.text: This iron fits my hand like a glove. I’ve dropped two irons in the past (one on the carpet!) due to the clumsiness that comes with my neurological condition. This little guy stands nice and sturdy on its feet, and I have better control of it due to its small size. I only gave four stars because it only has steam vents on the top of the ironing plate. With my wardrobe consisting of mostly cotton, I need to use a spray bottle of water to get the wrinkles out.
customer_reviews.author: Donna J Oliveira

customer_reviews.title: Works well -- perfect travel size
customer_reviews.text: So my husband and I recently traveled to a location that didn't have irons in the rooms. This would have come in handy. I just used it this morning to test it out, and ironed one shirt that was VERY wrinkly! I painstakingly did the whole shirt with that little iron (though when we travel we pre-iron and would only use it for touch ups). It worked like a gem and I had enough water to do the whole shirt, with a little left over. I recommend it for travelers!
customer_reviews.author: NOVA DIYers

customer_reviews.title: Best for low price
customer_reviews.text: This works amazingly for my purpose, which is heat setting paint into denim. It heats up in just a couple of seconds. Its quite easy to control and get the spots I want to heat. The wire doesn't really get in the way, and is easy to maneuver. I haven't used the steam setting and probably won't. The only downside for me so far is that it takes a while to cool down. Though I've never had an iron before so I don't have anything to compare it to.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: It leaks
customer_reviews.text: I love the weight of this. It's sturdy but lightweight. It does get really hot but if I turn on the steam option it leaks water all ove my fabric. I'd return it if I wasn't so lazy and if I didn't need a smaller iron for pressing the seams of my masks. I just won't use the steam option.
customer_reviews.author: Urekasgold

customer_reviews.title: Heard lots of good stuff and I bought 2 of these little steam ...
customer_reviews.text: Heard lots of good stuff and I bought 2 of these little steam irons, they arrived quick! One for my quilt shop and one to take traveling to quilt classes. Just tested it and it heats up super fast, about 15/20 seconds it was exetremely hot!!!! Steam works great! I am ecstatic that this out powers my regular $50 iron which takes about 3 minutes to fully heat up. I am definitely SOLD on these steam irons!
customer_reviews.author: Anita B.

customer_reviews.title: Tiny Iron
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: 3 MONTHS later, just stopped working. NO I do not recommend this. Any ideas what other little iron can work for making children face masks? I love this iron. I am amazed at how nice it works. fits the hand nicely and nice long cord on it for easier use. Price was reasonable and does what they say it does. "Would I recommend it" You bet yeah. Making face masks this works great. Don't know why I didn't order it earlier. Great product & it even came on time if not early.
customer_reviews.author: DebraKay

customer_reviews.title: Terrible iron/purchase!
customer_reviews.text: OMG! Terrible iron/purchase!! I plugged it in and it works intermittently while spitting water all over my fabric. At this point, I 'm not even sure if I can get it to work some of the time :( Back in the box! Don't waste your money (or time)!!
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my mother, she uses it for quilting ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my mother, she uses it for quilting. She really likes it. Heats up quickly and gets hot enough for cotton/linen. She keeps it on a TV tray next to her machine so she doesn't have to get up to the main ironing board to press small seams. Says it saves her a lot of time and effort.
customer_reviews.author: Jace

customer_reviews.title: but not the best product for
customer_reviews.text: Have only used this iron once, to try it out before my trip. I followed the directions for adding water for steam and sure enough, as others reported, the water leaks out all over the article of clothing. I should have listened to the reviews. It does heat up quickly and is hot and presses linen well. It will serve the purpose of a travel iron, but not the best product for sure
customer_reviews.author: Sherry E. Ewing

customer_reviews.title: Dont get ripped off!
customer_reviews.text: I would have given it 5 stars if it wasnt for the fact that I found this same iron at Walmart for 13 dollars. When I purchased this I got it for about 29 dollars. What a rip off!!! Just get it at walmart people! Other than that, it's a great little iron if you're going to use it for crafts or sewing projects.
customer_reviews.author: jp

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for travel.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for travel. I have been looking for one for awhile. Small, lightweight and it does a decent job in taking care of wrinkles. I adjusted temp to medium so I had no problems with the handle getting too hot like the other reviews said. Of course, this does not replace regular ironing that you do at home. Good for small jobs like t-shirt, silk/linen tops, maybe shorts that you take on trips.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little unit
customer_reviews.text: I finally used this iron for the first time this past weekend and it worked great! It doesn't get hideously hot but it does get all of the wrinkles out of things. I used it to iron regularly and to press a hem in anticipation of hand-sewing it. It's very lightweight and tiny. I would say that it takes a little longer than I would expect to cool down, but I don't think that's a big deal. I think it would be really easy to travel with. All in all I think this is a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Heather C

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size fo applique, quilting, and travel!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to order this iron, due to it's unusual shape. I do hand applique quilting and was looking for a small iron with a distinct point at the end, in order to iron and "mold" fabric across my freezer paper template. It turns out this little iron is perfect! The shape of the hand hold on the iron is very easy and comfortable to hold, and it does not extend near or over the "point" of the iron, thus giving me a very good field of vision. It heats to a high temperature and maintains the heat very well. It makes the most stubborn cotton a breeze to iron. I'm very happy with my new go-to iron!
customer_reviews.author: Lady Aggie

customer_reviews.title: Steamfast SF-717 Mini Steam Iron
customer_reviews.text: I purposely purchased this iron for my Bible Journaling artwork. Its perfect size is easy to store, easy to maneuver, easy to use for the purchase purpose. It heats up fast and stands up alone nicely between uses. Yes, my purchase was for my watercolor artwork but it's original purpose is for travel. Small about 6-7 inches, lightweight, steam or dry use. I'm very happy for this choice I made. I do recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ruthan Plant

customer_reviews.title: Great little quilters tool
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased this little iron a week ago. Working on a large quilt with a lot of quilt squares that had seams that need to be ironed between sewing together. Set it up next to my sewing table on my classroom cutting mat/ironing mat. The iron works great and is easy on the hand to hold. Would recommend this to my quilting friends.
customer_reviews.author: Pookies GiGi

customer_reviews.title: super convenient
customer_reviews.text: this small little thing packs some heat. the device heats up pretty quickly and stays hot. i needed an iron for trips that wont weigh me down but at the same time useful; this checked both boxes. the heat is pretty evenly distributed and hot. i was able to iron a pair of pants very quickly. for the size and heat factor, i would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: B.rose

customer_reviews.title: Small and powerful plus dual voltage
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for an international trip since many hotels in Europe do not have irons in the room. After looking at lots of reviews, this one fit what I needed - compact, light weight, dual voltage, steam setting. It works great! It regulates the temperature and you can hear it "click" off and also the light goes off and then it "clicks" back on and the light comes back on as it begins heating again. After turning it off, it does stay hot for a while, which is great for that little wrinkle you missed, but also makes it difficult to pop back into your suitcase if you are heading out the door.
customer_reviews.author: SLD

customer_reviews.title: Great Crafting iron
customer_reviews.text: I use this iron as I'm working on my textile projects. It heats up in a flash and is so light that ironing is no longer a drag. Now I can iron the pieces of cloth I'm going to use in my textile art without the hassle of bringing out my heavy iron and waiting for it to heat up. This iron is hot by the time I'm ready to use it. Maybe 10 seconds!
customer_reviews.author: N. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Good value for sewing or travel
customer_reviews.text: Great little iron for keeping by my side as I sew. It heats up quickly and the temperature stays steady (unlike my Rowenta, where the temperature control drifts.) I like it for little jobs since my sewing and ironing stations are in different rooms. It's lightweight so I can see it will be handy for travel, also. I don't recommend the steamer function, but that's not been a problem for me as I keep a spray bottle by my side.
customer_reviews.author: Vegan Dancer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for small household tasks
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased a number of handmade cloth face masks. The crafter suggested using an iron to remove wrinkles and restore pleats in the masks between washes. Since I've been washing my masks after each wear, I wanted a small handy iron that would be easy to pull out and use on a daily basis, if needed. This iron has been very effective and suits the task perfectly, especially given its size and light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine C

customer_reviews.title: Palm size efficient steam or dry necessity in my sewing room.
customer_reviews.text: Thought I certainly did not need another iron to add to my collection. I was mistaken. This little palm size steam iron is marvelous when preparing appliqué, small quilt pieces. It works perfectly dry or steam. Won’t drop on your fabric if you follow the included directions for using steam and or converting to dry press. It heats rather quickly and sails over fabric nicely or when used to press.
customer_reviews.author: llindalu

customer_reviews.title: Great little iron, gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for sewing projects. I love this iron, it heats up very quickly and managing the water is easy. I have been using it for getting out wrinkles and creating hems. It is just as good as a full size iron and more fun to use!
customer_reviews.author: Unsuspecting Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great
customer_reviews.text: I brought this to take to Italy since I heard they had no irons in hotel rooms. This lil iron worked great. It got nice and hot and the wrinkles were gone.
customer_reviews.author: N. Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Maybe mine is a one off?
customer_reviews.text: Well it worked. TWICE. 😡 This is all the way on and clearly no heat as I'm holding the pressing pad. So disappointed. It does kick on sometimes I that's something 🤷‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: A. Hearn

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: There is no way to express how much I love this little iron!!! It's perfect for crafts, sewing, and (bonus!) travel! The carrying bag is just perfect for my suitcase, and it fits very well in my hands while I'm ironing. I've used it pretty much non-stop for 2 days, and can't imagine why I ever fumbled with the larger iron!! This is fantastic! I love that I can use water IF I want to steam, but it's easy to go right back to NON-steam pressing. Great product. Seriously.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen M. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: I’m loving this little iron
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this iron. It gets hot and irons nicely using my wool mat as I press the pieces that I’m working on sewing. I wish I had thought or should I say, had seen this sooner. I couldn’t wait to use it. It came sooner than expected, it has a little cup for filling with water when u want steam, it also has a bag for it to fit into. So far I am extremely pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: CornbreadnRice

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this little pressing iron!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little pressing iron so much, I ended up buying 2. I use them both for my quilting. I have one for setting glue when I glue baste, but because the glue ends up in a line on the ironing plate, I decided I would order a second for strictly pressing (and keep the first one for strictly glue basting). I do not use the steam setting on either of these, I use these strictly for hot, dry heat.
customer_reviews.author: Dawnelle F Ward

customer_reviews.title: Steam feature spits on fabric leaving large wet spots.
customer_reviews.text: This iron heats very quickly and the small size and handle placement makes it very easy to use. Unfortunately, the steam feature does nothing but spits on the fabric leaving large wet spots. I read the reviews before purchasing, but did not read about this problem. Perhaps my iron is defective. I didn't return it because I thought it just needed breaking in and the problem would resolve itself. That was not the case.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Barbato

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this little iron to use on a pressing table next to my sewing machine. I couldn't be more pleased. The iron heats up quickly. The steam lasts surprisingly long for the little amount of water it holds. I use a squeeze bottle to fill the iron so I don't have to turn it off or cool it down between fills. I highly recommend the iron for seamstresses and quilters.
customer_reviews.author: TJ Ratchford

customer_reviews.title: Great for multi purpose heating
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use! And stores pretty much in any small extra space which is a bonus lol. I use it to press vinyl on odd shapes, which works out great since it's so small and easy to maneuver. I'm glad I made this purchase although I was hesitant for about a month or so.
customer_reviews.author: SynergyJ

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: Yes its light weight and compact, but 1, the iron leaked water, and 2, it does not get hot enough and is not heavy enough to get wrinkles out of anything. I tried multiple fabrics. It did not do the job of ironing.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: What a mighty little iron!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think such a little iron could pack so much power, but this totally surprised me! This is perfect for pressing quilting seams. I love that is has an on/off switch on the iron and you don't have to unplug it to turn it off - that's what I hate about my big iron. I'm so HAPPY with this purchase. If you are looking for a mighty helper in your sewing room, this is it! Excellent value!
customer_reviews.author: Randy V Jones

customer_reviews.title: No need to spend more...
customer_reviews.text: This is performing extremely well and even better than expected on my 100% cotton quilting patchwork. Was really tempted to purchase the Oliso little iron but read some reviews about how hot the handle got. I don't think it would have out-performed this little one! Steams like crazy and I expected to have to refill the tiny water reservoir multiple times during the day but it steamed ALL DAY LONG!
customer_reviews.author: JudieBee

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I am still unclear on how to turn it off, but i just unplug it. Also haven't tried steaming yet. For me, it heats up quickly, very easy to use for sewing hems, making binding tape, and smaller areas. So much easier to handle than my large regular iron. Exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just a Great Iron, Regardless of Size
customer_reviews.text: Wow. This iron is better than any full size iron I have ever owned. I love how quickly it heats up and how it still has that weighty iron feeling in such a tiny package. Plus, it's the perfect size for working on tiny sewing projects, like doll clothing. I was also really impressed by its cord- it's very heavy duty and has a good weight and feel to it. The whole thing just feels sturdy, and it's easy to use. The cover bag also comes in handy for storage. This was a great buy and helped my sewing immensely!
customer_reviews.author: Basil Abraxas

customer_reviews.title: OMG I so love this iron
customer_reviews.text: OMG I so love this iron. It is perfect for ironing doll clothes. The temperatures on it were a surprise to me, I didn't expect them to actually be like a big iron but they are. It's compact and fits in the right space in my crafting case(which isn't that big). Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo

customer_reviews.title: just dont store it with water
customer_reviews.text: the problem with modern irons is the steam function. I don't really use it but once and a while and thats probably why ive never faced a broken iron. if you use the steam feature, empty the water and let it stay dry. and remember to clean it. if you do that, this is just as good as any full size iron ive used, if not better! the smaller size works way better for shirt collars or focusing on problem spots.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Morse

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Little Iron!
customer_reviews.text: I am not the greatest at leaving reviews, but I absolutely love this little thing. It is the perfect size for me to use while sewing masks, and I am sure it will be perfect for the other items I sew as well. There is not really much more to say other than this : if you sew, especially accessories, you will want this iron in your life.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn B.

customer_reviews.title: Love this little work horse iron!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little iron. I have been making masks and it is perfect to press all sides. No problems with leaking or anything else that some have said. Just need to be patient and let the iron heat up. I will be using this for regular sewing projects as well. I don't know how I have done without it until now. Great and well worth every penny! Can quickly and safely also.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Leaks!
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed in this product. I just received it today. I filled the cup almost to the max line and it started spilling out of the iron at about 3/4 full. I heated the iron, started ironing and the water poured out of the holes on the plate. Soaking three pieces of the fabric I was ironing. When I set the iron down the water still poured out of the holes onto my table. I would not recommend this product. And yes I followed all of the instructions in the booklet that came with it.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Beckwith

customer_reviews.title: A grandma (I forgot & accidentally left it on overnight!!) & happy quilter.!
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts this small (!!) little thing could really work & be of a help! I love it! It’s right next to my sewing machine w the ironing pad (I bought on amazon) & I can press every seam allowance as I see!! It works perfectly. Heats well! Lightweight! I even accidentally left it on over night setting on pad, no problem,still warm/hot but, not about to catch fire! Pad is well insulated w a rubber place for iron to set. Thx!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good heat, tips easily
customer_reviews.text: The only downside is the iron is so small, the cord is almost too heavy for it and it tips over a little easier than it should. But the size is perfect and the heat is even. I got this to use on my perler projects - already have used it for clothing, too. I’m very happy.
customer_reviews.author: CottonCandy

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for a travel iron for my quilting classes. I don't use the seam, but use a spray bottle. Don't want to worry about leaking while traveling. Heats up fast. Perfect size to get into small places. Has a long cord (great because when you travel there are never wall plugs where you need them). Product ship/delivered fast. Great price for a great iron. Thinking about getting another one to keep by my pressing mat by my sewing table; getting to old to keep getting up and using the big iron and iron board!
customer_reviews.author: Paula H

customer_reviews.title: I love this tiny iron
customer_reviews.text: So I never thought I'd say this, but this small iron is the best thing ever!!!! I used it for the first time the other day to iron my baby's outfit. It worked so well. It wasn't intrusive or big and bulky. Plus it takes up hardly any room to store it. I don't know about the handle getting hot because it didn't do it to me. Though, I only had it half way on the heat dial. We will see how it is after a few uses.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda I.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this iron to use in my classroom for crafting purposes. It has worked extremely well. Also, it’s compact size is convenient for transporting and storing. I’m the type of person who hangs clothes in the bathroom as I shower as opposed to ironing; however, I love this little iron so much that I plan to purchase another for when I need to remove wrinkles from clothing. It will come in handy for traveling, too. And, quite frankly, it’s also adorable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small and mighty!
customer_reviews.text: This little iron is small but powerful! I’m so glad I bought it! Admittedly, it was an impulse buy, but I knew there had to be an easier way to steam seams open without lugging out my big iron. One of my best purchases ever. I have since seen YouTube Videos where people are using this exact iron. It fits in the palm of your hand perfectly and it doesn’t get hot to hold even when plugged in for hours at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Philpam

customer_reviews.title: I Love This Lil Iron!
customer_reviews.text: I looked at quite a few mini irons and chose this from the reviews, and the fact that is a dry or steam iron. It really does a great job! It's perfect for my sewing room to press seams open as you sew. Also great for other small ironing projects. I love that it uses less electricity too. It's a great little portable iron, cute an efficient.
customer_reviews.author: chongo

customer_reviews.title: Tiny but powerful!
customer_reviews.text: Love this mini iron! I took this to 4 different European countries this summer and never had an issue. It's tiny but completely gets the job done. It gets hot quickly and steam features works without having to stop to refill water. It was so easy to use. Storage wax the best part, it wasn't too heavy and the cord wraps perfectly around the handle so I carried this is my carry on and check in bag. Also, it also comes with a really long cord so it can reach the plug and the full length of your clothes.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Love Love Love!
customer_reviews.text: I have so much more space on my small ironing board and it works like a dream! If you want a blast of stream then push the button in and then release and blast off! I can even iron heavy canvas with it. Aesomeness!
customer_reviews.author: Mzz Acevez

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant Little Iron!!!!!! Buy It!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m just loving this little iron! Am working on masks right now and it’s brilliant so easy to use, nice and hot cools down quickly. I never put water into my irons, distilled or not. I use a spray bottle and this little guy gets right to work. One of my favorite craft tools in my memory! If you’re on the fence, buy it. Worth every penny to me.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lee
